result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey R Bain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey R Bain

Sentencing Hearing, May 30, 2017
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Sentencing hearing on May 30, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant appeared in court without counsel. Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State. Jim Pearson in court for JMH. Court addressed lack of counsel. Defendant did not object to State's motion. Court granted motion. Defendant terminated from Drug Diversion Court. Trial branch to schedule sentencing.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.
Drug Court Diversion Contract

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not be at any Boston Store.
- Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.
Review hearing at 12-22-2015 09:00 am

Reporter:  digital recorder - 2:55
Defendant in court with Attorney Jon O. Helland.  Erin Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty on Ct 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 01-05-2016 10:00 am
New case. Set FPT
Atty Helland
Final pre-trial at 11-04-2015 10:00 am
Set FPT. Qualifies for SPD
Final pre-trial at 09-22-2015 08:30 am

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not be at any Boston Store.
  Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant appeared.  Emily L. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
